snippet: Gov. Pete Wilson today vetoed a gay rights bill that was bitterly opposed by many conservatives and church groups.   The bill would have outlawed job discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation. Before final passage by the Legislature, housi...
lead_paragraph: Gov. Pete Wilson today vetoed a gay rights bill that was bitterly opposed by many conservatives and church groups. The bill would have outlawed job discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation. Before final passage by the Legislature, housing discrimination had been eliminated from the measure by its sponsor, Assemblyman Terry Friedman, Democrat of Sherman Oaks, to try to ease opposition.

headline.main: California Governor Vetoes Gay Rights Measure
